articles.title: Argentina Hints at Post-Messi Era in Youthful Squad
articles.description: Franco and Valentín Carboni, Alejandro Garnacho, Nicolás Paz, Tiago Geralnik and Luka Romero are playing in youth divisions of European clubs, but they were summoned by Argentina on Monday.
articles.content:
Argentina’s squad for the two final rounds of South American World Cup qualifying shows coach Lionel Scaloni could be thinking about the future without Lionel Messi.

articles.title: Rain then dry spell positive for Argentine crops, harvest: weather expert

articles.title: Steven Gerrard handed double Aston Villa problem ahead of Wolves clash
articles.description: A look at the international situation involving Aston Villa duo Emi Martinez and Emi Buendia who are scheduled to link up with Argentina later this month despite both serving suspensions

Emi Martinez and Emi Buendia have both been called up for international duty later this month - despite both being given a two-game ban.

articles.title: ‘The Murders of Moisés Ville’ Review: A Forgotten ‘Jerusalem’
articles.description: Argentina’s Jewish agricultural colonies were once so successful that Theodor Herzl briefly considered situating the Jewish State there.
articles.content: The Argentine journalist Javier Sinay’s family memoir, “The Murders of Moisés Ville: The Rise and Fall of the Jerusalem of South America,” is as fascinating as it is quirky—a journey that begins in the impoverished Jewish communities of late 19th- an... [522 chars]

articles.title: Feast or famine: untimely shifts in South American weather pattern bring wetter weather at harvest
articles.description: March will bring widespread precipitation across Argentina and southern Brazil. While it is much needed, timing is unfortunate as soybean harvest continues and safrinha crop is planted.
articles.content: The weather turned favorable for soybean harvest across much of Brazil as the calendar flipped to March. Drier weather allowed farmers to get into the fields for harvest and planting activities. Meanwhile, rainfall in the growing regions of Argentina... [1636 chars]

articles.title: In pope's homeland of Argentina, court jails powerful bishop for sex abuse
articles.description: The high-profile trial played out in the home country of Pope Francis, the former archbishop of Buenos Aires and the first Latin American pontiff of the Church. Gustavo Zanchetta, the former bishop of Oran in Argentina's northern province of Salta, was convicted of sexually abusing two former seminarians, which prosecutors said in a statement was aggravated due to his status as a cleric.
articles.content: A Catholic bishop accused of sexually abusing young men studying to be priests was found guilty by a court in northern Argentina on Friday, capping over a week of often graphic testimony in the latest criminal abuse case to hit the global Church. The... [2828 chars]
